greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n, k) = c(n, q)/(c(k, q)*c(n-k, q)), where c(n, q) = Product_{j=1..n} (j+q)!/(j-1)! and q = 8.
comment: Triangle of generalized binomial coefficients (n,k)_9; cf. A342889. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 03 2021
These sequences (q >= 2) are a generalization of A056939.
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 0..100 of triangle, flattened
Johann Cigler, Pascal triangle, Hoggatt matrices, and analogous constructions, arXiv:2103.01652 [math.CO], 2021.
formula: T(n, k, q) = c(n, q)/(c(k, q)*c(n-k, q)) where c(n, q) = Product_{j=1..n} (j+q)!/(j-1)! and q=8.
T(n, k, q) = (G(q+2)*G(k+1)*G(n+q+2)*G(n-k+1))/(G(n+1)*G(k+q+2)*G(n-k+q+ 2)), where G(x) is the Barnes G-function (see A000178). - _G. C. Greubel_, Apr 13 2019
mathematica: Table[T[n, k, 8], {n, 0, 10}, {k, 0, n}]//Flatten (* modified by _G. C. Greubel_, Apr 13 2019 *)
Table[T[n, k, 8], {n, 0, 10}, {k, 0, n}]//Flatten (* _G. C. Greubel_, Apr 13 2019 *)
xref: Triangles of generalized binomial coefficients (n,k)_m (or generalized Pascal triangles) for m = 1,...,12: A007318 (Pascal), A001263, A056939, A056940, A056941, A142465, A142467, A142468, A174109, A342889, A342890, A342891.
